message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire a unique item that will bring you a lot of value. I'm willing to sell it to you for $120.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob. However, $90 is a bit lower than I was hoping for. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, so I'll counteroffer at $110. This is my best price for now.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit lower on the budget. Would you be willing to consider $95?

I'm glad you're still interested in the product, Bob. I can see you're trying to get a good deal. I'm willing to meet you at $100, which is my minimum price. If you're willing to meet me there, we can finalize the deal.
I'm getting close to your minimum price, but I'm still a bit short. Would you be willing to meet me at $97?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I'll meet you at $99, which is just $1 above my minimum price. If you're willing to meet me there, we can finalize the deal.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still a bit short. Would you be willing to meet me at $98?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the end of our negotiations, Bob. I'm willing to make one final concession. I'll meet you at $99.50, which is just 50 cents above my minimum price. If you're willing to meet me there, we can finalize the deal.
I appreciate your efforts, but I'm still not willing to go above $98. This is my final offer. Would you be willing to meet me there?
